conversations.content: Oop! Beggin' your pardon, miss.
Oh, er, I'm sorry as well...
*sigh*
(I made up my mind to travel the world outside of the hidden village, but I still can't quite get used to all this.)
(I'm always on edge, watching over my shoulder. It wasn't like this when I was with him...)
(I miss Tobias. But where would I even go to see him again?)
Oh, right, the Halidom!
A few days later...
(I think I'm nearly there, but I still don't see anything resembling a castle.)
(Did I take a wrong turn? Maybe I should stop and ask someone.)
Huh. That crowd is awfully noisy.
Eeagh! Please, milady! Forgive this fool!
Done already? As I recall, YOU were the one to challenge ME.
I'll pay every coin back, I swear! So please, I beg you! Spare me!
You will do as you've promised, and furthermore, you will never return to this village. Swear it.
I do, merciful lady! I swear! ...Goodbye!
Thank you, dearie. You've been a huge help.
Think nothing of it. I could scarcely allow a merchant in name only to continue perpetrating his fraud here.
You were awesome, Elisanne!
Ha ha. Thank you. If you have any troubles in the future, do let me know.
I shall come running from the Halidom.
The Halidom!
Hm? Yours is a face I haven't seen around these parts.
I'm Nino. I'm trying to get to the Halidom to see a man called Tobias.
Ah, you're a friend of Tobias! I'm Elisanne. I trained together with Tobias at the Church, and these days I reside at the Halidom.
I'm afraid he's not at the castle now, though.
He's not? Argh. What should I do, then?
You would be welcome to stay at the castle until he returns, if you like.
You'll have no worry of accidentally missing one another that way. I doubt he'll be long.
You don't mind?
Not at all. Shall we, then?
(Elisanne... She seems about my age?)
(But she's so much more mature. She's poised and regal and well-respected.)
(The outside world has so many kinds of people...)
You all right, Nino? This is your welcome party! Eat up!
Ah, er...
Is the food not to your taste?
Oh, no, it's delicious. I've just never eaten in such a...lively setting before.
This is pretty much normal around here! Not much of a party animal, girlio?
Maybe not? But it's nice to watch others having a good time.
As long as we're not freakin' you out. So, what was it like back home for you, Nino?
Yeah, don't let us hog the conversation all night, or we'll never learn anything about you!
Go on, tell us everything! Dish!
Well...
(If I told them I was Ilia's descendant, they would never treat me like this again.)
(And that's the last thing I want.)
I lived alone, out in the woods. But I've been traveling, ever since I met Tobias.
(Better that I keep my secrets close.)
(I've only just forged these new connections...and I'd hate to see them ruined so soon.)
This good for flowers, Cleo?
Yes, thank you. These should make for a lovely table setting.
I picked some, too.
How sweet of you, Nino. Thank— *gasp*
Uh, Cleo? What's wrong?
You have to burn those! NOW! Otherwise—
Fiends?!
It seems my warning came too late.
When plucked, that flower seems to emit a scent that lures in fiends.
We can't detect it, but apparently it's, like, the fiend equivalent of catnip. Or a jumbo platter of fresh chocolate chip cookies!
I'm so sorry. I had no idea.
It's our fault for not explaining earlier. But for now, we have more pressing matters...
There's a village ahead. We have to stop them here!
Nino, can you fight?
(With their numbers, we'll be wiped out unless I fight at full strength.)
(But they'll see my wing. I'll have to explain who I really am.)
(And then everything will change...)
Krgh...!
CLEO!
(I've put both a new friend and an entire village in danger.)
(This is no time for selfish doubts. Ancestor, lend me your power!)
HAAAAAH!
Cleo, back me up as best you can!
That wing...
I can fight! I won't let a single one of them past!
*huff...* *pant...*
That seems to be the last of them.
Yeah! I burned all of the flowers, so we should be all right. So, uh...
Nino. That was a faerie wing, wasn't it? But why just one? What's the story there?
Are you a faerie? Or... What are you?
(As soon as I tell them, our friendship is over. What's worse, it will mean putting all of them in danger.)
(I would rather part ways without saying a word than do them harm.)
It was a pleasure staying with you all. ...Goodbye.
Wha?! Hey, wait! Nino! Where are you going?!
Nino...
(It's well and truly dark out, but I can't go back to the castle now.)
(May as well find a clearing to bed down for the night.)
Hold it, girly!
You... You were the one back at the village who Elisanne laid flat!
What, turned to banditry out here with your little friends now that you can't fleece the villagers out of their money? I pity you.
Ugh, you a friend of that she-devil?! I'm still aching from the lumps she gave me.
But I can find it in my heart to forgive, if you leave all your belongings behind. Now, let's have 'em!
And if I refuse?
Ain't it obvious, girl? We take 'em by force!
What kinda monster is she?!  A wing just sprouted from her back!
I won't go down easy.
Heh heh. We've struck gold, boys!
Nino! Are you all right?!
Elisanne?
YOU!
I see my previous lesson didn't stick. Back to your mischief already?
It's just one more girl, lads! Get 'em both!
Gladly. This won't end the way it did the last time, wench!
Nino, can you stand? We need to get through this. We can talk after.
Sure.
HRAAAAAH!
...Well? You're not going to ask, Elisanne?
Would you like me to?
Hah... That might be the easier way, at this point.
I wanted to keep it hidden, but I don't suppose I have that option anymore.
I caused you all such trouble, and then I just ran away. You even saw my wing. What can I even do to make ame—
It's quite lovely.
Huh?
Your wing. The way it catches the moonlight. It's beautiful.
...And? That's all?
It's a faerie wing. And I'm a human. You don't think I'm a freak of nature?
Why would I? You have a wing, and that is that. It's not my place to pry.
Why not?
Because I can trust you.
This afternoon, you revealed your secret so that you could fight to protect my friends and the people of this land.
You clearly wished to keep it hidden, yet you put the safety of others before your own desires.
That alone is enough to earn you my trust. No matter who or what you might be, I believe you. I believe IN you.
And I'm certain everyone else at the Halidom would say the same. At this point, you're our friend, Nino. One of us.
Now, come. Let's head back.
Am...am I really welcome?
Of course. Why else would I come looking for you? Shall we? The others are waiting.
*SOB* NINOOOOO! I'm so glad you're back! I was really freaking out thinking how you were out there wandering in the dark!
I'm glad to see you're all right. I have a hot bowl of soup waiting for you. Go and warm yourself up.
Er, thank you... Both of you.
(They really aren't asking. They legitimately intend to accept me here.)
(And honestly? I believe they would. No matter who I turned out to be.)
I'm sorry to have worried you. I... I'm back now. To stay.
Good. Welcome home to the Halidom, Nino.
Day 13, month of the Prismawyrm.  Elisanne was kind enough to lend me a book. It's a little...beyond me, though.
It's a story of a knight and a princess falling in love, but the concept kind of goes over my head.
Will the day ever come when I think of someone as being special to me in that way?
Mm? Is that a diary you're keeping, dear?
Huh? Er, yes, um...?
Cassandra. Court sorceress. I keep one too, which is why I ask.
I'm Nino.
Nothing beats the feel of watching letters fill up a page from end to end, don't you think?
Interesting phrasing. Is that why you keep a diary, child? Because you enjoy the act of writing?
Er...yes? Is that strange?
I would think most people do it to keep a record of their thoughts for posterity.
That's my reason, at least.
I see. I've just always loved reading and writing since I was a child.
(I never had any playmates back at the hidden village. Books were about all I had to pass the time.)
That was what got me started on journaling. I guess I assumed it was the same for everyone.
Actually, there was even a time when I wanted to be an author when I grew up.
You've plenty of growing up left to do, my dear. No reason to give up the dream now.
You know what? You might be right.
Before, I knew basically nothing about normal life. Never had a conversation with a friend, or a family dinner. I'd never been shopping.
All the things I wrote about—all my wildly imaginative fantasies—turned out to be completely ordinary.
Seems you had quite the upbringing.
It was...unique. And yet, the people here have welcomed me into their home.
Now I'm living the normal life I'd dreamed of for so long. I've never been so happy. I really can't thank you all enough.
So even the humdrum routines of everyday life can feel like storybook reveries to the right person. Fascinating.
That record you're keeping may just become a document of vast historical importance in the future.
Why do you say that?
Well, considering what it is our little prince and the others are trying to accomplish here...
A chronicle of the path they traced may hold profound meaning someday.
Wow. That kind of boggles the mind.
Day 14, month of the Prismawyrm.  I spoke about diaries with a woman named Cassandra.
I had never even considered that someone else might read these entries.
Could these idle thoughts and ramblings really hold any meaning for anyone besides myself?
(Something written without any deep thought that would later influence others...)
I'm sure the Scrolls of Perdition are a prime example of that.
(My ancestor documented history as it truly happened, and entrusted the key to her family line.)
(Why she bothered to leave behind such a nuisance has always escaped me.)
(It's not as if she wanted to pass that truth on to anyone. Maybe she just wanted to know that it existed, in some form.)
The truth, lost from living memory... Her daughter's existence...
(Maybe she meant it to be a record for herself alone—to keep her own memories alive.)
That's so sad...
Today, I felt sympathy for my ancestor for the first time in my life.
I'm certain I never would have felt this emotion if I hadn't seen the world outside.
It's all because you set me free, Tobias. What I'd give to see you again.
*pant...* *pant...*
Pardon me! Coming through!
If it isn't Nino. What has you so out of breath, child?
Ah! Tobias is—er, sorry. I heard that an acquaintance of mine arrived at the castle!
Sorry, Cassandra. I have to go!
Can't bear to be apart for even one moment longer, eh? Ahhh, youth.
(Tobias, where are you?)
Ah, Tob—
Elisanne!
Tobias. Good to see you safe.
Still in one piece...for now. Though I can't say the same for the Church these days.
We'll have to keep vigilant. If there's aught I can help with, let me know.
I can always count on you. Thank you.
(I can't bring myself to step out there. I feel like I'd only be in the way.)
(I was nothing but a burden to Tobias. Someone in need of protection. But she's different. He relies on her.)
(He NEEDS Elisanne. And she... I know. I know, but still...)
(Why does this feel so...painful? What's wrong with me?)
Guess who's here, Nino? I know you've been eager to see him.
No, I... I don't really need to...
Hm? Why are you fidgeting?
I'm not fidgeting!
Just go away. Er, please. I... I don't feel like speaking right now.
Nino, what's gotten into—
You heard the girl, Elisanne. Let's be on our way.
I'm such a fool. Elisanne didn't deserve to be treated like that.
(She's been nothing but kind to me. Why can't I do the same?)
(And Tobias! I wanted to see him so badly, but then I scorned him for no reason...)
(What is this mess of feelings tangled inside me? I don't understand myself!)
If it means feeling like this and hurting people who have done nothing wrong, I wish I'd never left the village.
I wish I'd never met Tobias at all...
Oh, hello again, dear. Where are you off to with the sun so low in the sky?
Cassandra...
You're not exactly traveling light. Running away from home, are we?
Guessed it in one, I presume. You look miserable, child. The opposite of your beaming face this morning.
Lover's quarrel?
No. And we aren't lovers.
Mm-hmmm. Then what troubles you?
I don't know. I'm stricken with an illness. Or maybe it's a curse.
These feelings inside me keep getting bigger and bigger and there's nothing I can do to control them.
Ahhh, to be young again!
What?
Nothing, darling. Shall I have a look at you, then? Diagnose what ails you?
You won't find a sorceress better suited for the task.
Er...really?
Love...? What's hurting me is love? You're certain it's not a curse?
No, that can't possibly...! Love is supposed to be this effervescent joy that rises from the depths of your soul! All the novels I've read say—
This world has its share of dark and painful love as well, child. I fear it's far more common than the bubbly sort you describe.
That's why the beautiful kind gets written about in stories.
I don't understand at all...
Precious thing, we aren't meant to. We have to learn about it, bit by bit. And if it turns out it wasn't love, that's fine, too.
The world is bursting at the seams with new emotions for you to discover.
Some will hurt, but they're all worth experiencing for yourself. Without running. Without giving up.
The only one to avoid is regret! And you'd regret this dusky egress of yours, I'm sure.
It seems to me you have something you need to take care of. Ask your heart and it shall speak the answer.
I... I need to apologize to Elisanne and Tobias.
There, clear as day. Off you go, then. Chop chop!
I'm going. And thank you, Cassandra.
...Ha ha, still just a babe. I'm ALMOST envious.
At my age! Unbecoming, I know.  But can you blame me, Aurelius?
*gasp...* *pant...* Elisanne! I finally found you!
What's wrong, Nino? You're completely out of breath.
I'm sorry!
I was absolutely horrible to you earlier! I won't blame you if you don't forgive me, but at least let me apologize!
I was a bit surprised, but I certainly don't hold it against you.
R-really? You promise? You don't hate me now?
Why would I? Please, don't look so frightened.
You're so amazing, Elisanne. I've looked up to you from the moment we first met.
Wh-what's all this, now? I fear flattery will get you nothing from me.
Don't worry. I don't need any more than you've already given me.
Just being my friend is so much more than I could've ever hoped for.
You mean the world to me, Elisanne.
Tobias...
Hello, Nino.
I'm sorry about earlier. I was so rude for no reason.
I'll forgive you, this once. But don't make a habit of causing others to worry about you.
Hey! Look, I... I've wanted to see you, Tobias. Since we parted, really.
I came here to find you, and I've been waiting for you to return ever since.
(I have to tell him how I really feel. Even if it hurts...the one thing I want to avoid is regret.)
I'm really glad we met.
